Unit.description: Data type represents a unit. This means a composite type with a number and a unit part is used.

ariaLabelledBy.description: Association to controls / IDs that label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).
ariaLabelledBy.helpDescription: Association to controls / IDs that label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

fieldHelp.description: Optional FieldHelp. This is an association that allows the usage of one FieldHelp instance for multiple fields. Note: If the field is inside of a table, do not set the FieldHelp instance as dependent to the field. If you do every field instance in every table row gets a clone of it. Put the FieldHelp instance e.g. as dependent on the table or page. The FieldHelp instance must be somewhere in the control tree, otherwise there might be rendering or update issues. Note: For Boolean fields, no FieldHelp should be added, but a default FieldHelp used instead.

sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase.description: The FieldBase control is the basic control to be used within the {@link sap.ui.mdc.Field Field} and {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} controls. It must not be used stand-alone.
sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FieldBase. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getDataType dataType} : string (default: 'sap.ui.model.type.String')
    • {@link #getDataTypeConstraints dataTypeConstraints} : object
    • {@link #getDataTypeFormatOptions dataTypeFormatOptions} : object
    • {@link #getEditMode editMode} : sap.ui.mdc.enum.EditMode (default: Editable)
    • {@link #getRequired required} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getDisplay display} : sap.ui.mdc.enum.FieldDisplay (default: Value)
    • {@link #getTextAlign textAlign} : sap.ui.core.TextAlign (default: Initial)
    • {@link #getTextDirection textDirection} : sap.ui.core.TextDirection (default: Inherit)
    • {@link #getPlaceholder placeholder} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getValueState valueState} : sap.ui.core.ValueState (default: None)
    • {@link #getValueStateText valueStateText} : string
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getMultipleLines multipleLines} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getMaxConditions maxConditions} : int (default: -1)
    • {@link #getConditions conditions} : object[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getLabel label} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getDelegate delegate} : object (default: ...see text or source)
    • {@link #getShowEmptyIndicator showEmptyIndicator} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #get_fieldHelpEnabled _fieldHelpEnabled} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #get_ariaAttributes _ariaAttributes} : object (default: {})
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control (default)
    • {@link #getContentEdit contentEdit} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getContentDisplay contentDisplay} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getFieldInfo fieldInfo} : sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldInfoBase
  • Associations
    • {@link #getFieldHelp fieldHelp} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldHelpBase)
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:liveChange liveChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:submit submit} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.Control#constructor sap.ui.mdc.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase.helpDescription: The FieldBase control is the basic control to be used within the {@link sap.ui.mdc.Field Field} and {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} controls. It must not be used stand-alone.

contentEdit.description: Optional content to be rendered if the editMode property is not set to Display. Note: If a control is assigned to the content aggregation, this one is ignored. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType ConditionType} as type. Warning: Only controls allowed in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent} interface needs to be implemented by these controls.

conditions.description:
Sets the conditions that represent the values of the field. This should be bound to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel} using the corresponding fieldPath. Note: For {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} controls, the conditions property must be used to bind {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}.
For example, for a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control inside a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar} control the binding looks like this:
conditions="{$filters>/conditions/propertyPath}" with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • propertyPath as the property name
For an Any (see {@link sap.ui.model.FilterOperator}) {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control, the binding looks like this:
conditions='{$filters>/conditions/navPath*/propertyPath}' with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • navPath#42;/ as the navigation property name
  • propertyPath as the property name
Between navPath and propertyPath, */ is required. Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}.
conditions.helpDescription:
Sets the conditions that represent the values of the field. This should be bound to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel} using the corresponding fieldPath. Note: For {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} controls, the conditions property must be used to bind {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}.
For example, for a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control inside a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar} control the binding looks like this:
conditions="{$filters>/conditions/propertyPath}" with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • propertyPath as the property name
For an Any (see {@link sap.ui.model.FilterOperator}) {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control, the binding looks like this:
conditions='{$filters>/conditions/navPath*/propertyPath}' with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • navPath#42;/ as the navigation property name
  • propertyPath as the property name
Between navPath and propertyPath, */ is required. Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}.

maxConditions.helpDescription: Sets the maximum amount of conditions that are allowed for this field. The default value of -1 indicates that an unlimited amount of conditions can be defined. Note If the data type used doesn't support multiple conditions, an error is thrown.

sap.ui.mdc.name: sap.ui.mdc
sap.ui.mdc.description:
The SAPUI5 library that contains the metadata-driven controls and other entities.

SAP Internal This library is restricted to use by SAP internal projects only.

sap.ui.mdc.FilterBarDelegate.description: Base Delegate for {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar}. Extend this object in your project to use all functionalites of the {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar}. Note: The class is experimental and the API/behavior is not finalized and hence this should not be used for productive usage.
sap.ui.mdc.FilterBarDelegate.helpDescription: Base Delegate for {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar}. Extend this object in your project to use all functionalites of the {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar}. Note: The class is experimental and the API/behavior is not finalized and hence this should not be used for productive usage.

eventParams.oControlEvent.getParameters.valid: type: boolean, description: Flag that indicates if the entered value is valid
eventParams.oControlEvent.getParameters.promise: type: Promise, description: Returns a Promise for the change. The Promise returns the value if it is resolved. If the change event is synchronous, the promise has already been already resolved. If it is asynchronous, it will be resolved after the value has been updated. The Field should be set to busy during the parsing to prevent user input. As there might be a whole group of fields that needs to be busy, this cannot be done automatically.
eventParams.oControlEvent.getParameters.value: type: string, description: The new value of the Field. If a FieldHelp is assigned to the Field, the value is used as key for the FieldHelp items.

change.name: change
change.description: This event is fired when the value property of the field is changed by user interaction. Note This event is only triggered if the used content control has a change event.
change.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

A maximum of 5 actionGroups is displayed inside the popover, though more can be added to the aggregation.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar.description:
The FilterBar control is used to display filter properties in a user-friendly manner to populate values for a query. The filters are arranged in a logical row that is divided depending on the space available and the width of the filters. The Go button triggers the search event, and the Advanced Filters button shows the filter dialog.
The FilterBar control creates and handles the filters based on the provided metadata information. The metadata information is provided via the {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBarDelegate FilterBarDelegate} implementation. This implementation has to be provided by the application.
sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FilterBar. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowAdaptFiltersButton showAdaptFiltersButton} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowGoButton showGoButton} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getP13nMode p13nMode} : sap.ui.mdc.FilterBarP13nMode[]
    • {@link #get_p13nModeItem _p13nModeItem} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #get_p13nModeValue _p13nModeValue} : boolean (default: false)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.filterbar.FilterBarBase#constructor sap.ui.mdc.filterbar.FilterBarBase} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar.helpDescription:
The FilterBar control is used to display filter properties in a user-friendly manner to populate values for a query. The filters are arranged in a logical row that is divided depending on the space available and the width of the filters. The Go button triggers the search event, and the Advanced Filters button shows the filter dialog.
The FilterBar control creates and handles the filters based on the provided metadata information. The metadata information is provided via the {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBarDelegate FilterBarDelegate} implementation. This implementation has to be provided by the application.

Defines the path to the metadata retrieval class for the FilterBarBase control. It basically identifies the {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBarDelegate FilterBarDelegate} file that provides the required APIs to create the filter bar content.
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Note: This property must not be bound.

Additionally, if the liveMode property is active, the following applies:
The error message box is not displayed, and the showMessages property is ignored.

fieldHelp.description: Optional FieldHelp. This is an association that allows the usage of one FieldHelp instance for multiple fields. Note: If the field is inside of a table, do not set the FieldHelp instance as dependent to the field. If you do every field instance in every table row gets a clone of it. Put the FieldHelp instance e.g. as dependent on the table or page. The FieldHelp instance must be somewhere in the control tree, otherwise there might be rendering or update issues. Note: For Boolean fields, no FieldHelp should be added, but a default FieldHelp used instead.

Note: For Boolean fields, no FieldHelp should be added, but a default FieldHelp used instead.

sap.ui.mdc.FilterField.description: The FilterField control is used to filter data based on the conditions. The conditions are managed in the corresponding {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}. That is why the conditions property must be bound to the related conditions in the {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}. The type of this data must be defined in the dataType property.
sap.ui.mdc.FilterField.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FilterField. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getOperators operators} : string[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getDefaultOperator defaultOperator} : string
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase#constructor sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.FilterField.helpDescription: The FilterField control is used to filter data based on the conditions. That is why the conditions property must be bound to the related conditions in the {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}. The type of this data must be defined in the dataType property.

contentEdit.description: Optional content to be rendered if the editMode property is not set to Display. Note: If a control is assigned to the content aggregation, this one is ignored. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType ConditionType} as type. Warning: Only controls allowed in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent} interface needs to be implemented by these controls.

conditions.description:
Sets the conditions that represent the values of the field. This should be bound to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel} using the corresponding fieldPath. Note: For {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} controls, the conditions property must be used to bind {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}.
For example, for a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control inside a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar} control the binding looks like this:
conditions="{$filters>/conditions/propertyPath}" with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • propertyPath as the property name
For an Any (see {@link sap.ui.model.FilterOperator}) {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control, the binding looks like this:
conditions='{$filters>/conditions/navPath*/propertyPath}' with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • navPath#42;/ as the navigation property name
  • propertyPath as the property name
Between navPath and propertyPath, */ is required. Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}.
conditions.helpDescription:

Note: For {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} controls, the conditions property must be used to bind {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}.
For example, for a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control inside a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar} control the binding looks like this:
conditions="{$filters>/conditions/propertyPath}" with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • propertyPath as the property name
For an Any (see {@link sap.ui.model.FilterOperator}) {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control, the binding looks like this:
conditions='{$filters>/conditions/navPath*/propertyPath}' with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • navPath#42;/ as the navigation property name
  • propertyPath as the property name
Between navPath and propertyPath, */ is required. Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}.

sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelp.description: A field help used in the FieldHelp association of controls based on {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase FieldBase} that shows a value help dialog.
sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelp.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FieldValueHelp. If a more complex value help is needed, the application can add a table to this field help. As the behavior depends on the used table control in this case, a wrapper is used between the used control and the FieldValueHelp element. Note: If a FieldValueHelp element is connected to a field, it gets the BindingContext of this field. So the in and out parameters are done in this context. Therefore bind the content table in such a way that that it finds its data also in the BindingContext of the field. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getDelegate delegate} : object (default: ...see text or source)
    • {@link #getFilterFields filterFields} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getKeyPath keyPath} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getDescriptionPath descriptionPath} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getShowConditionPanel showConditionPanel} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getNoDialog noDialog} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #get_enableOK _enableOK} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelpContentWrapperBase (default)
    • {@link #getSuggestContent suggestContent} : sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelpContentWrapperBase
    • {@link #getDialogContent dialogContent} : sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelpContentWrapperBase
    • {@link #getFilterBar filterBar} : sap.ui.mdc.filterbar.FilterBarBase
    • {@link #getInParameters inParameters} : sap.ui.mdc.field.InParameter[]
    • {@link #getOutParameters outParameters} : sap.ui.mdc.field.OutParameter[]
    • {@link #getCollectiveSearchItems collectiveSearchItems} : sap.ui.core.Item[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:dataRequested dataRequested} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldHelpBase#constructor sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldHelpBase} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelp.helpDescription: A field help used in the FieldHelp association of controls based on {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase FieldBase} that shows a value help dialog.

collectiveSearchItems.description: Items for collective searches. If used, a field to switch value helps will be shown. If the value help is switched, the contentRequest function of the delegate is called and the chosen key is provided. Note: Icons are not supported.
collectiveSearchItems.helpDescription: Items for collective searches. If used, a field to switch value helps will be shown. If the value help is switched, the contentRequest function of the delegate is called and the chosen key is provided. Note: Icons are not supported.

dialogContent.description: Content for dialog. To support different types of content (for example sap.m.Table), a specific wrapper is used to map the functionality of the content control to the field help. The content control is assigned to the wrapper. The filter logic must be implemented in the wrapper control. The filtering is triggered by user interaction (type-ahead, search request, or search from FilterBar). (If FilterBar is in LiveMode and in parameters are used, this also triggers filtering.) Note: If no special content for the dialog is provided, the content of the content aggregation is used.

To support different types of content (for example sap.m.Table), a specific wrapper is used to map the functionality of the content control to the field help. The content control is assigned to the wrapper. The filter logic must be implemented in the wrapper control. The filtering is triggered by user interaction (type-ahead, search request, or search from FilterBar). (If FilterBar is in LiveMode and in parameters are used, this also triggers filtering.) Note: If no special content for the dialog is provided, the content of the content aggregation is used.

filterFields.description: The fields based on which the table data is filtered. For filtering the value of the filterValue property is used. If set to $search and the used binding supports search requests, a $search request is used for filtering. If set to one or more properties, the filters for these properties are used for filtering. These filters are set on the ListBinding used. The properties need to be separated by commas and enclosed by "*" characters. ("*Property1,Property2*") If it is empty, no suggestion is available.

sap.ui.mdc.p13n.StateUtil.description: Utility class for state handling of MDC Controls. The StateUtil is offering a generic way to retrieve and apply a desired state to a given MDC Control. The StateUtil class is tightly coupled to the flex integration of MDC Controls, to use Stateutil API's the given MDC Control instance needs to fully enable all available p13nMode options in order for the StateUtil to create the required changes and retrieve the according state of the control.

sourceControl.description: Gets the app component required for link personalization. Also, the source control is used to get the binding context.
sourceControl.helpDescription: Gets the app component required for link personalization. Also, the source control is used to get the binding context.

sap.ui.mdc.Link.description:
A Link control can be used to handle navigation scenarios with one or more targets through direct navigation or by opening a {@link sap.ui.mdc.link.Panel}.
It can also be used to display additional content, such as {@link sap.ui.mdc.link.ContactDetails} on the {@link sap.ui.mdc.link.Panel}. Note: Navigation targets are determined by the implementation of a {@link sap.ui.mdc.LinkDelegate}.
sap.ui.mdc.Link.constructorDescription:
Constructor for the new Link Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEnablePersonalization enablePersonalization} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getDelegate delegate} : object (default: ...see text or source)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSourceControl sourceControl} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldInfoBase#constructor sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldInfoBase} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.Link.helpDescription:
A Link control can be used to handle navigation scenarios with one or more targets through direct navigation or by opening a {@link sap.ui.mdc.link.Panel}.
It can also be used to display additional content, such as {@link sap.ui.mdc.link.ContactDetails} on the {@link sap.ui.mdc.link.Panel}. Note: Navigation targets are determined by the implementation of a {@link sap.ui.mdc.LinkDelegate}.

delegate.description:
Path to LinkDelegate module that provides the required APIs to create content for the Link control.
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. Once the required module is associated, this property might not be needed any longer.
delegate.helpDescription:
Path to LinkDelegate module that provides the required APIs to create content for the Link control.
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. Once the required module is associated, this property might not be needed any longer.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

ariaHasPopup.description:
Defines the aria-haspopup attribute of the Toolbar. if the active design is true. Guidance for choosing appropriate value:
  • We recommend that you use the {@link sap.ui.core.aria.HasPopup} enumeration.
  • If you use controls based on sap.m.Popover or sap.m.Dialog, then you must use AriaHasPopup.Dialog (both sap.m.Popover and sap.m.Dialog have role "dialog" assigned internally).
  • If you use other controls, or directly sap.ui.core.Popup, you need to check the container role/type and map the value of ariaHasPopup accordingly.
ariaHasPopup.helpDescription:
Defines the aria-haspopup attribute of the Toolbar. if the active design is true. Guidance for choosing appropriate value:

  • If you use other controls, or directly sap.ui.core.Popup, you need to check the container role/type and map the value of ariaHasPopup accordingly.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

active.description: Indicates that the whole toolbar is clickable. The Press event is fired only if Active is set to true. Note: This property should be used when there are no interactive controls inside the toolbar and the toolbar itself is meant to be interactive.
active.helpDescription: Indicates that the whole toolbar is clickable. The Press event is fired only if Active is set to true. Note: This property should be used when there are no interactive controls inside the toolbar and the toolbar itself is meant to be interactive.

asyncMode.description: Defines whether the OverflowToolbar works in async mode. Note: When this property is set to true, the OverflowToolbar makes its layout recalculations asynchronously. This way it is not blocking the thread immediately after re-rendering or resizing. However, it may lead to flickering, when there is a change in the width of the content of the OverflowToolbar.
asyncMode.helpDescription: Defines whether the OverflowToolbar works in async mode. Note: When this property is set to true, the OverflowToolbar makes its layout recalculations asynchronously. enabled.description: Sets the enabled property of all controls defined in the content aggregation. Note: This property does not apply to the toolbar itself, but rather to its items.

Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

sap.ui.mdc.filterbar.vh.CollectiveSearch.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new CollectiveSearchSelect. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getSelectedItemKey selectedItemKey} : string
    • {@link #get_currentItemText _currentItemText} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.core.Item[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

Constructor for a new DefineConditionPanel. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getConditions conditions} : object[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getFormatOptions formatOptions} : object (default: {})
    • {@link #getLabel label} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getInputOK inputOK} : boolean (default: true)

In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

See {@link #setFieldGroupIds}, or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldMultiInput.description: The FieldMultiInput control is used to render a multi-input field inside a control based on {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase FieldBase}.
sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldMultiInput.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FieldMultiInput. The FieldMultiInput control enhances the {@link sap.m.MultiInput MultiInput} control to add ARIA attributes and other {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase FieldBase}-specific logic. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getAriaAttributes ariaAttributes} : object (default: {})
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.MultiInput#constructor sap.m.MultiInput} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldMultiInput.helpDescription: The FieldMultiInput control is used to render a multi-input field inside a control based on {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase FieldBase}.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

suggestionItems.description: Defines the items displayed in the suggestion popup. Changing this aggregation (by calling addSuggestionItem, insertSuggestionItem, removeSuggestionItem, removeAllSuggestionItems, or destroySuggestionItems) after Input is rendered opens/closes the suggestion popup. To display suggestions with two text values, add sap.ui.core.ListItem as SuggestionItems (since 1.21.1). For the selected ListItem, only the first value is returned to the input field. Note: Only text and additionalText property values of the item are displayed. For example, if an icon is set, it is ignored. To display more information per item (including icons), you can use the suggestionRows aggregation. Note: Disabled items are not visualized in the list with the suggestions, however they can still be accessed through the aggregation.
suggestionItems.helpDescription: Defines the items displayed in the suggestion popup. Changing this aggregation (by calling addSuggestionItem, insertSuggestionItem, removeSuggestionItem, removeAllSuggestionItems, or destroySuggestionItems) after Input is rendered opens/closes the suggestion popup. To display suggestions with two text values, add sap.ui.core.ListItem as SuggestionItems (since 1.21.1). For the selected ListItem, only the first value is returned to the input field. Note: Only text and additionalText property values of the item are displayed. For example, if an icon is set, it is ignored. To display more information per item (including icons), you can use the suggestionRows aggregation. Note: Disabled items are not visualized in the list with the suggestions, however they can still be accessed through the aggregation.

suggestionColumns.description: The suggestionColumns and suggestionRows are for tabular input suggestions. This aggregation allows for binding the table columns; for more details see the aggregation "suggestionRows".
suggestionColumns.helpDescription: The suggestionColumns and suggestionRows are for tabular input suggestions. This aggregation allows for binding the table columns; for more details see the aggregation "suggestionRows".

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

Deprecated! Since 1.9.1 sap.m.DatePicker, sap.m.TimePicker or sap.m.DateTimePicker should be used for date/time inputs and formating.
Only used if type=date and no datepicker is available. The data is displayed and the user input is parsed according to this format. Note: The value property is always of the form RFC 3339 (YYYY-MM-dd).

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

showSuggestion.description: If this is set to true, suggest event is fired when user types in the input. Changing the suggestItems aggregation in suggest event listener will show suggestions within a popup. When runs on phone, input will first open a dialog where the input and suggestions are shown. When runs on a tablet, the suggestions are shown in a popup next to the input.

enableMultiLineMode.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.58 Replaced with N-more/N-items labels, which work in all cases.
If set to true, the MultiInput will be displayed in multi-line display mode. In multi-line display mode, all tokens can be fully viewed and easily edited in the MultiInput. The default value is false. Note: This property does not take effect on smartphones or when the editable property is set to false. Caution: Do not enable multi-line mode in tables and forms.

Deprecated! Since 1.58 Replaced with N-more/N-items labels, which work in all cases.

The default value is false. Note: This property does not take effect on smartphones or when the editable property is set to false. Caution: Do not enable multi-line mode in tables and forms.

type.description:
HTML type of the internal input tag (e.g. Text, Number, Email, Phone). The particular effect of this property differs depending on the browser and the current language settings, especially for the type Number.
This parameter is intended to be used with touch devices that use different soft keyboard layouts depending on the given input type.
Only the default value sap.m.InputType.Text may be used in combination with data model formats. sap.ui.model defines extended formats that are mostly incompatible with normal HTML representations for numbers and dates.

Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

The default value is true. Note: If suggestions are not tabular or no suggestions are used, the button will not be displayed and this flag is without effect.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

selectedKey.helpDescription: Defines the key of the selected item. Note: If duplicate keys exist, the first item matching the key is used.

startSuggestion.description: Minimum length of the entered text in input before suggest event is fired. The default value is 1 which means the suggest event is fired after user types in input. Note: When it's set to 0, suggest event is fired when input with no text gets focus. In this case no suggestion popup will open.

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.
visible.helpDescription: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

valueLiveUpdate.description: Indicates when the value gets updated with the user changes: At each keystroke (true) or first when the user presses enter or tabs out (false). Note: When set to true and the value of the Input control is bound to a model, the change event becomes obsolete and will not be fired, as the value in the model will be updated each time the user provides input. In such cases, subscription to the liveChange event is more appropriate, as it corresponds to the way the underlying model gets updated.

maxSuggestionWidth.description: If set, the value of this parameter will control the horizontal size of the suggestion list to display more data. This allows suggestion lists to be wider than the input field if there is enough space available. By default, the suggestion list is always as wide as the input field. Note: The value will be ignored if the actual width of the input field is larger than the specified parameter value.

submit.name: submit
submit.description:
This event is fired when user presses the Enter key on the input. Notes:
  • The event is fired independent of whether there was a change before or not. If a change was performed, the event is fired after the change event.
  • The event is also fired when an item of the select list is selected via Enter.
  • The event is only fired on an input which allows text input (editable, enabled and not valueHelpOnly).
submit.helpDescription:
This event is fired when user presses the Enter key on the input. Notes:
  • The event is fired independent of whether there was a change before or not. If a change was performed, the event is fired after the change event.
  • The event is also fired when an item of the select list is selected via Enter.
  • The event is only fired on an input which allows text input (editable, enabled and not valueHelpOnly).

sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelpContentWr.description: Base type for FieldValueHelp content control wrapper.
sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelpContentWr.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FieldValueHelpContentWrapperBase. The FieldValueHelp element supports different types of content. To map the content control API to the FieldValueHelp element, a wrapper is needed. This base class just defines the API. Note: All events and functions must only be used by the corresponding field help. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSelectedItems selectedItems} : object[] (default: []) (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:navigate navigate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:selectionChange selectionChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:dataUpdate dataUpdate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelpContentWr.helpDescription: Base type for FieldValueHelp content control wrapper.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldHelpBase.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FieldHelpBase. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getConditions conditions} : object[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getDelegate delegate} : object (default: ...see text or source)
    • {@link #getFilterValue filterValue} : string (default: "") (default)
    • {@link #getValidateInput validateInput} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:navigate navigate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:dataUpdate dataUpdate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:disconnect disconnect} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:open open} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterClose afterClose} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.Element#constructor sap.ui.mdc.Element} can be used as well.

validateInput.description:
If this property is set, the user input is validated against the field help. If no entry is found for the user input, an error occurs.

If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the field help. But if no entry is found, the user input is set to the field if the used data type allows this. (A type parsing error is shown if the user input adheres to the requirements of the used data type.)

In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

sap.ui.mdc.filterbar.FilterBarBase.description: The FilterBarBase control is used as a faceless base class for common functionality of any MDC FilterBar derivation.
sap.ui.mdc.filterbar.FilterBarBase.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FilterBarBase. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getDelegate delegate} : object (default: ...see text or source)
    • {@link #getLiveMode liveMode} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowMessages showMessages} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowGoButton showGoButton} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFilterConditions filterConditions} : object (default: {})
    • {@link #getSuspendSelection suspendSelection} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #get_filterCount _filterCount} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getFilterItems filterItems} : sap.ui.mdc.FilterField[] (default)
    • {@link #getBasicSearchField basicSearchField} : sap.ui.mdc.FilterField
  • Associations
    • {@link #getVariantBackreference variantBackreference} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:search search} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:filtersChanged filtersChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.Control#constructor sap.ui.mdc.Control} can be used as well.

    • {@link #getMinHeight minHeight} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: "400px")

validateInput.description:
If this property is set, the user input is validated against the field help. If no entry is found for the user input, an error occurs.

If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the field help. But if no entry is found, the user input is set to the field if the used data type allows this. (A type parsing error is shown if the user input adheres to the requirements of the used data type.)

fieldHelp.description: Optional FieldHelp. This is an association that allows the usage of one FieldHelp instance for multiple fields. Note: If the field is inside of a table, do not set the FieldHelp instance as dependent to the field. If you do every field instance in every table row gets a clone of it. Put the FieldHelp instance e.g. as dependent on the table or page. The FieldHelp instance must be somewhere in the control tree, otherwise there might be rendering or update issues. Note: For Boolean fields, no FieldHelp should be added, but a default FieldHelp used instead.

contentEdit.description: Optional content to be rendered if the editMode property is not set to Display. Note: If a control is assigned to the content aggregation, this one is ignored. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType ConditionType} as type. Warning: Only controls allowed in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent} interface needs to be implemented by these controls.

Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Warning: Only controls allowed in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent} interface needs to be implemented by these controls.

conditions.description:
Sets the conditions that represent the values of the field. This should be bound to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel} using the corresponding fieldPath. Note: For {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} controls, the conditions property must be used to bind {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}.
For example, for a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control inside a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar} control the binding looks like this:
conditions="{$filters>/conditions/propertyPath}" with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • propertyPath as the property name
For an Any (see {@link sap.ui.model.FilterOperator}) {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control, the binding looks like this:
conditions='{$filters>/conditions/navPath*/propertyPath}' with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • navPath#42;/ as the navigation property name
  • propertyPath as the property name
Between navPath and propertyPath, */ is required. Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}.
conditions.helpDescription:
Sets the conditions that represent the values of the field. This should be bound to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel} using the corresponding fieldPath. Note: For {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} controls, the conditions property must be used to bind {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}.
For example, for a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control inside a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar} control the binding looks like this:
conditions="{$filters>/conditions/propertyPath}" with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • propertyPath as the property name
For an Any (see {@link sap.ui.model.FilterOperator}) {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control, the binding looks like this:
conditions='{$filters>/conditions/navPath*/propertyPath}' with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • navPath#42;/ as the navigation property name
  • propertyPath as the property name
Between navPath and propertyPath, */ is required. Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}.

sap.ui.mdc.ChartNew.description: The Chart control creates a chart based on metadata and the configuration specified.
sap.ui.mdc.ChartNew.constructorDescription:
/** Constructor for a new Chart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getDelegate delegate} : object (default: ...see text or source)
    • {@link #getHeader header} : string
    • {@link #getNoDataText noDataText} : string (default: "No data")
    • {@link #getP13nMode p13nMode} : sap.ui.mdc.ChartP13nMode[]
    • {@link #getLegendVisible legendVisible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getIgnoreToolbarActions ignoreToolbarActions} : sap.ui.mdc.ChartToolbarActionType[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getMinWidth minWidth} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: "240px")
    • {@link #getMinHeight minHeight} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: "400px")
    • {@link #getSortConditions sortConditions} : object
    • {@link #getShowChartTooltip showChartTooltip} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAutoBindOnInit autoBindOnInit} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getChartType chartType} : string (default: "column")
    • {@link #getShowSelectionDetails showSelectionDetails} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.mdc.chartNew.ItemNew[] (default)
    • {@link #getActions actions} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #get_toolbar _toolbar} : sap.ui.mdc.chartNew.ChartToolbarNew
    • {@link #get_breadcrumbs _breadcrumbs} : sap.m.Breadcrumbs
    • {@link #get_innerChart _innerChart} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getSelectionDetailsActions selectionDetailsActions} : sap.ui.mdc.chartNew.SelectionDetailsActionsNew
  • Associations
    • {@link #getFilter filter} : (sap.ui.core.ID | undefined)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectionDetailsActionPressed selectionDetailsActionPressed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:dataPointsSelected dataPointsSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:innerChartLoadedData innerChartLoadedData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.Control#constructor sap.ui.mdc.Control} can be used as well.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

initialValueFilterEmpty.description: If set, an initial value of InParameter starts a filtering for the empty operator. Note: This property must not be used for {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} and if bound to {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}. In this case, a filtering for the empty operator must be defined by the assigned conditions. Note: This property must only be set if the data type used supports a filtering for the empty operator. Note: Do not set this property if an empty string is a valid key for the InParameter used.
initialValueFilterEmpty.helpDescription: If set, an initial value of InParameter starts a filtering for the empty operator. Note: This property must not be used for {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} and if bound to {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}. In this case, a filtering for the empty operator must be defined by the assigned conditions. Note: This property must only be set if the data type used supports a filtering for the empty operator. Note: Do not set this property if an empty string is a valid key for the InParameter used.

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

fixedValue.description: Fixed value which is set on the OutParameter element. Note: This property is only used if helpPath is not set.
fixedValue.helpDescription: Fixed value which is set on the OutParameter element. Note: This property is only used if helpPath is not set.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

Constructor for a new FieldValueHelpUITableWrapper. The FieldValueHelp element supports different types of content. This is a wrapper to use a sap.ui.table.Table control as content. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionFieldHelp.description: A field help used in the FieldHelp association in FieldBase controls to show a popover of conditions.
sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionFieldHelp.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ConditionFieldHelp. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getLabel label} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #get_enableOK _enableOK} : boolean (default: true)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldHelpBase#constructor sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldHelpBase} can be used as well.

filterValue.helpDescription: The value by which the help is filtered. Note: This only takes effect if the FieldHelp element supports filtering. Note: This property must only be set by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

validateInput.description:
If this property is set, the user input is validated against the field help. If no entry is found for the user input, an error occurs.

If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the field help. But if no entry is found, the user input is set to the field if the used data type allows this. (A type parsing error is shown if the user input adheres to the requirements of the used data type.)

If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the field help. But if no entry is found, the user input is set to the field if the used data type allows this. (A type parsing error is shown if the user input adheres to the requirements of the used data type.)

If the change event is synchronous, the promise has already been already resolved. If it is asynchronous, it will be resolved after the value has been updated. sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldInput.description: The FieldInput control is used to render an input field inside a control based on {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase FieldBase}.
sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldInput.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FieldInput. The FieldInput control enhances the {@link sap.m.Input Input} control to add ARIA attributes and other {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase FieldBase}-specific logic. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getAriaAttributes ariaAttributes} : object (default: {})
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.Input#constructor sap.m.Input} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldInput.helpDescription: The FieldInput control is used to render an input field inside a control based on {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase FieldBase}.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

suggestionItems.description: Defines the items displayed in the suggestion popup. Changing this aggregation (by calling addSuggestionItem, insertSuggestionItem, removeSuggestionItem, removeAllSuggestionItems, or destroySuggestionItems) after Input is rendered opens/closes the suggestion popup. To display suggestions with two text values, add sap.ui.core.ListItem as SuggestionItems (since 1.21.1). For the selected ListItem, only the first value is returned to the input field. Note: Only text and additionalText property values of the item are displayed. For example, if an icon is set, it is ignored. To display more information per item (including icons), you can use the suggestionRows aggregation. Note: Disabled items are not visualized in the list with the suggestions, however they can still be accessed through the aggregation.
suggestionItems.helpDescription: Defines the items displayed in the suggestion popup. Changing this aggregation (by calling addSuggestionItem, insertSuggestionItem, removeSuggestionItem, removeAllSuggestionItems, or destroySuggestionItems) after Input is rendered opens/closes the suggestion popup. To display suggestions with two text values, add sap.ui.core.ListItem as SuggestionItems (since 1.21.1). For the selected ListItem, only the first value is returned to the input field. Note: Only text and additionalText property values of the item are displayed. For example, if an icon is set, it is ignored. To display more information per item (including icons), you can use the suggestionRows aggregation. Note: Disabled items are not visualized in the list with the suggestions, however they can still be accessed through the aggregation.

suggestionColumns.description: The suggestionColumns and suggestionRows are for tabular input suggestions. This aggregation allows for binding the table columns; for more details see the aggregation "suggestionRows".
suggestionColumns.helpDescription: The suggestionColumns and suggestionRows are for tabular input suggestions. This aggregation allows for binding the table columns; for more details see the aggregation "suggestionRows".

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.
tooltip.helpDescription: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

Deprecated! Since 1.9.1 sap.m.DatePicker, sap.m.TimePicker or sap.m.DateTimePicker should be used for date/time inputs and formating.
Only used if type=date and no datepicker is available. The data is displayed and the user input is parsed according to this format. Note: The value property is always of the form RFC 3339 (YYYY-MM-dd).

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

showSuggestion.description: If this is set to true, suggest event is fired when user types in the input. Changing the suggestItems aggregation in suggest event listener will show suggestions within a popup. When runs on phone, input will first open a dialog where the input and suggestions are shown. When runs on a tablet, the suggestions are shown in a popup next to the input.

type.description:
HTML type of the internal input tag (e.g. Text, Number, Email, Phone). The particular effect of this property differs depending on the browser and the current language settings, especially for the type Number.
This parameter is intended to be used with touch devices that use different soft keyboard layouts depending on the given input type.
Only the default value sap.m.InputType.Text may be used in combination with data model formats. sap.ui.model defines extended formats that are mostly incompatible with normal HTML representations for numbers and dates.
